CronSchedule.description: Cron schedules establishes that a job must be executed with a periodicity based on a unix like crontab expression.

expression.description: Cron expression for the job execution, for more information see.

timeZone.description: Time zone for the cron programming, for example "Europe/Madrid". For more information see.

HttpRecipient.description: Recipient definition that executes a http request on a given url and sends the configured "payload" as the body.

url.description: Url of the recipient that will receive the request.

method.description: Http method to use for the request.

headers.description: Http headers to send with the request.

queryParams.description: Http query parameters to send with the request.

JobV2.description: Defines a job that can be managed by the jobs service.

id.description: The unique identifier of the job in the system, this value is set by the jobs service.

correlationId.description: Logical user provided identifier of the job in the system.

executionTimeout.description: Optional configuration that establishes the time limit for the current Job execution attempt to finish. When this timeout is exceeded the execution attempt is considered as failed, and depending on the Job retry  configuration, the execution can be retried or the Job will be marked as ERROR. Every Recipient type has a default timeout configuration that will apply automatically if this value is not set, and a maximum timeout configuration that can not be exceeded by current value.

executionTimeoutUnit.description: The unit for the executionTimeout. If the executionTimeout is set and the unit is left empty MILLISECONDS are assumed. If the unit is set and the executionTimeout is left empty this value is ignored.

Recipient.description: Generic definition for a Recipient, users must provide instances of subclasses of this schema to create a job.

Retry.description: The retry configuration establishes the number of times a failing job execution must be retried before it’s considered as FAILED.

maxRetries.description: Number of retries to execute in case of failures.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time to continue retrying if no successful execution was produced.

Schedule.description: Generic definition for a Schedule, users must provide instances of subclasses of this schema.

TimerSchedule.description: Timer schedules establishes that a job must be executed at a given date time and can be repeated a configurable number of times.

startTime.description: Initial fire time for the job in the ISO-8601 standard.

repeatCount.description: Number of times that the job execution must be repeated.
